optcom.effects package¶

Submodules¶

optcom.effects.absorption module¶

class optcom.effects.absorption.Absorption(sigma, Gamma, doped_area, UNI_OMEGA=True)¶

Bases: optcom.effects.active_fiber_photon_process.ActiveFiberPhotonProcess

The absorption effect.

omega¶

The angular frequency array. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

time¶

The time array. \([ps]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

domega¶

The angular frequency step. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

float

dtime¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

Parameters

  • sigma -- The absorption cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is prodived, variable must be wavelength. \([nm]\)

  • Gamma -- The overlap factor. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • doped_area -- The doped area. \([\mu m^2]\)

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

abstract op(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The operator of the effect.

Parameters

  • waves -- The wave packet.

  • id -- The ID of the considered wave in the wave packet.

  • corr_wave -- Corrective wave, optional, use if needed.

Returns

The operator of the effect.

optcom.effects.abstract_effect_taylor module¶

class optcom.effects.abstract_effect_taylor.AbstractEffectTaylor(coeff, order_taylor=1, start_taylor=0, skip_taylor=[], UNI_OMEGA=False)¶

Bases: optcom.effects.abstract_effect.AbstractEffect

An effect which need a Taylor Series expansion.

omega¶

The angular frequency array. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

time¶

The time array. \([ps]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

domega¶

The angular frequency step. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

float

dtime¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

order_taylor¶

The order of coeff coefficients Taylor series expansion to take into account.

Parameters

  • coeff -- The derivatives of the coefficients.

  • order_taylor -- The order of coeff coefficients Taylor series expansion to take into account. (will be set to the length of the coeff array if one is provided)

  • start_taylor -- The order of the derivative from which to start the Taylor series expansion.

  • skip_taylor -- The order_taylors of the derivative to not consider.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

coeff(omega, order=None)¶
delay_factors(id)¶

Return the time delay induced by the effect.

property order_taylor¶
set(center_omega=array([], dtype=float64), abs_omega=array([], dtype=float64))¶
term(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The term of the effect.

Parameters

  • waves -- The wave packet.

  • id -- The ID of the considered wave in the wave packet.

  • corr_wave -- Corrective wave, optional, use if needed.

Returns

The term of the effect.

optcom.effects.active_fiber_photon_process module¶

class optcom.effects.active_fiber_photon_process.ActiveFiberPhotonProcess(sigma, Gamma, doped_area, UNI_OMEGA=True)¶

Bases: optcom.effects.abstract_effect.AbstractEffect

The process photon can encounter in an active fiber, i.e. stimulated emission, spontaneous emission, absorption.

omega¶

The angular frequency array. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

time¶

The time array. \([ps]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

domega¶

The angular frequency step. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

float

dtime¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

Parameters

  • sigma -- The absorption cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is prodived, variable must be wavelength. \([nm]\)

  • Gamma -- The overlap factor. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • doped_area -- The doped area. \([\mu m^2]\)

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

op(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The operator of the effect.

Parameters

  • waves -- The wave packet.

  • id -- The ID of the considered wave in the wave packet.

  • corr_wave -- Corrective wave, optional, use if needed.

Returns

The operator of the effect.

set(center_omega=array([], dtype=float64), abs_omega=array([], dtype=float64))¶
term(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The operator of the emission effect.

optcom.effects.attenuation module¶

class optcom.effects.attenuation.Attenuation(alpha, order_taylor=1, start_taylor=0, skip_taylor=[], UNI_OMEGA=True)¶

Bases: optcom.effects.abstract_effect_taylor.AbstractEffectTaylor

The fiber attenuation effect.

omega¶

The angular frequency array. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

time¶

The time array. \([ps]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

domega¶

The angular frequency step. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

float

dtime¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

order_taylor¶

The order of coeff coefficients Taylor series expansion to take into account.

Parameters

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variables must be (\(\omega\), order) where \(\omega\) angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • order_taylor -- The order of alpha coefficients Taylor series expansion to take into account. (will be set to the length of the alpha array if one is provided)

  • start_taylor -- The order of the derivative from which to start the Taylor series expansion.

  • skip_taylor -- The order_taylors of the derivative to not consider.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

op(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The operator of the attenuation effect.

optcom.effects.coupling module¶

class optcom.effects.coupling.Coupling(kappa, order_taylor=1, start_taylor=0, skip_taylor=[])¶

Bases: optcom.effects.abstract_effect.AbstractEffect

omega¶

The angular frequency array. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

time¶

The time array. \([ps]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

domega¶

The angular frequency step. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

float

dtime¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

Parameters

  • kappa -- The coupling coefficients. \([km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • order_taylor -- The order of kappa coefficients Taylor series expansion to take into account. (will be set to the length of the kappa array if one is provided)

  • start_taylor -- The order of the derivative from which to start the Taylor series expansion.

  • skip_taylor -- The order_taylors of the derivative to not consider.

delay_factors(id)¶

Return the time delay induced by the effect.

optcom.effects.dispersion module¶

class optcom.effects.dispersion.Dispersion(beta, order_taylor=2, start_taylor=0, skip_taylor=[], UNI_OMEGA=True)¶

Bases: optcom.effects.abstract_effect_taylor.AbstractEffectTaylor

The dispersion effect.

omega¶

The angular frequency array. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

time¶

The time array. \([ps]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

domega¶

The angular frequency step. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

float

dtime¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

order_taylor¶

The order of coeff coefficients Taylor series expansion to take into account.

Parameters

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variables must be (\(\omega\), order) where \(\omega\) angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • order_taylor -- The order of beta coefficients Taylor series expansion to take into account. (will be set to the length of the beta array if one is provided)

  • start_taylor -- The order of the derivative from which to start the Taylor series expansion.

  • skip_taylor -- The order_taylors of the derivative to not consider.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

op(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The operator of the dispersion effect.

optcom.effects.gain module¶

class optcom.effects.gain.Gain(g, order_taylor=1, start_taylor=0, skip_taylor=[], UNI_OMEGA=True)¶

Bases: optcom.effects.abstract_effect_taylor.AbstractEffectTaylor

The fiber gain effect.

omega¶

The angular frequency array. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

time¶

The time array. \([ps]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

domega¶

The angular frequency step. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

float

dtime¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

order_taylor¶

The order of coeff coefficients Taylor series expansion to take into account.

Parameters

  • g -- The derivatives of the gain coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variables must be (\(\omega\), order) where \(\omega\) angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • order_taylor -- The order of g coefficients Taylor series expansion to take into account. (will be set to the length of the g array if one is provided)

  • start_taylor -- The order of the derivative from which to start the Taylor series expansion.

  • skip_taylor -- The order_taylors of the derivative to not consider.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

op(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The operator of the gain effect.

class optcom.effects.gain_saturation.GainSaturation(gain, en_sat, UNI_OMEGA=True)¶

dtime¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

Parameters

  • gain -- The gain coefficient. \([km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • en_sat -- The energy saturation. \([J]\) If a callable is provided, the variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

optcom.effects.kerr module¶

class optcom.effects.kerr.Kerr(SPM=False, XPM=False, FWM=False, sigma=2.0)¶

Bases: optcom.effects.abstract_effect.AbstractEffect

The Kerr effect.

omega¶

The angular frequency array. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

time¶

The time array. \([ps]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

domega¶

The angular frequency step. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

float

dtime¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

SPM¶

If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

XPM¶

If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

FWM¶

If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

sigma¶

Positive term multiplying the XPM term.

Parameters

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM term.

op(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The operator of the effect.

Parameters

  • waves -- The wave packet.

  • id -- The ID of the considered wave in the wave packet.

  • corr_wave -- Corrective wave, optional, use if needed.

Returns

The operator of the effect.

op_fwm(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶
op_spm(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The operator of the self-phase modulation effect.

op_xpm(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The operator of the cross-phase modulation effect.

set(center_omega=array([], dtype=float64), abs_omega=array([], dtype=float64))¶

optcom.effects.raman module¶

class optcom.effects.raman.Raman(h_R, self_term=True, cross_term=False, eta=2.0)¶

Bases: optcom.effects.abstract_effect.AbstractEffect

The Raman scattering effect.

omega¶

The angular frequency array. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

time¶

The time array. \([ps]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

domega¶

The angular frequency step. \([ps^{-1}]\)

Type

float

dtime¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

self_term¶

If True, trigger the self-term of the effect.

cross_term¶

If True, trigger the cross-term influence in the effect.

eta¶

Positive term multiplying the cross terms in the effect.

Parameters

  • h_R -- The Raman response function values. If a callable is provided, variable must be time. \([ps]\)

  • self_term -- If True, trigger the self-term of the effect.

  • cross_term -- If True, trigger the cross-term influence in the effect.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross terms in the effect.

op(waves, id, corr_wave=None)¶

The operator of the Raman effect.

set(center_omega=array([], dtype=float64), abs_omega=array([], dtype=float64))¶

The time step. \([ps]\)

Type

float

T_R¶

The raman coefficient. \([]\)

self_term¶

If True, trigger the self-term of the effect.

cross_term¶

If True, trigger the cross-term influence in the effect.

eta¶

Positive term multiplying the cross terms in the effect.

approx_type¶

The type of the NLSE approximation.

Parameters

  • T_R -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • self_term -- If True, trigger the self-term of the effect.

  • cross_term -- If True, trigger the cross-term influence in the effect.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross terms in the effect.

  • approx_type -- The type of the NLSE approximation.
